meanings.definition: Assigning an actor a role based on their perceived characteristics or previous roles.
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the actor felt frustrated by the typecasting he faced, always playing the same kind of character.
meanings.sent2: Typecasting can limit an actor's opportunities to showcase their range and talent.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch about typecasting in Hollywood had everyone laughing at the absurdity of it all.
meanings.sent4: Being stuck in the cycle of typecasting can feel like being trapped in a never-ending loop of predictability.
meanings.sent5: The concept of typecasting is like being put into a box and never allowed to break free.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a mold or impression of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist used typecasting to make a perfect replica of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: Typecasting is essential in creating detailed sculptures and artworks.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun experimenting with typecasting using playdough and clay.
meanings.sent4: Typecasting in pottery involves carefully shaping the clay to capture every detail.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of typecasting lies in its ability to capture the essence of an object in a tangible form.
